result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew G Culver

records.addlTxt:
10:00 AM Defendant Matthew G Culver in court.  Attorney Aaron B Marcoux in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Matthew Krische appeared by video for Matthew G Culver. Court calls case and appearances. Waived reading. Not guilty plea is entered. Set for status. Bond to continue.
Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 02:35 pm.
Status conference on September 12, 2022 at 02:35 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 002319,
Payable Number: 70841,
Receipt Number: 22R 002218,
Amount: $20.00

1:27 PM Defendant Matthew G Culver appeared by video in custody at the Washburn County Jail. Culver makes statement on his representation, states he will be hiring private counsel/Attorney Matt Krische. Court reviews probable cause statement. Court reviews current address, DE states main address S5085 State Rd 37, Eau Claire 54701 7158282955. Received notices sufficiently at that address. Reviews employment, contacts with Washburn County. DA makes bond recommendation and conditions. Requests no contact with CRM, W2756 Rockford Rd until 12:00 p.m. on 5/7/2022 to allow CRM to vacate residence. Absolute sobriety. Not to consume or possess any alcohol. Not to enter premises that sells alcohol for consumption unless for employment. Not to consume or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription. $250 cash $2500 signature bond. DE makes statement regarding vehicle at residence in Sarona, discussion of 3rd party to retrieve.  Court orders no contact with CRM, W256 Rockford Rd until after 1:00 p.m. on 5/7/2022 to allow CRM to vacate residence. Absolute sobriety. Not to consume or possess any alcohol. Not to enter any establishments that sells alcohol for consumption on premises unless for employment. Not to consume or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription. $250 cash $2500 signature bond.
Bail/Bond Review scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
